title: [MAC] Unable to connect to pvp.net server
body: For the past few days I have been unable to login to the game. Every time I try it just gives me the error on the login screen. I've tried changing the trust level in the certificates and downloaded 2 certificates after following one of the fixes posted awhile ago. After all that I am still unable to login. Can someone please help me on this issue. I have also reinstalled several times, restarted my com and none of them work.

replies.body: What happens when you try to visit the [support page](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us)?
I can load the support page just fine. I also tried searching for a fix on the support page. But non worked so far..

You aren't getting the same problem as many other Mac users are getting. Nevertheless, a solution they used was [temporarily switching over to Google's Public DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#mq3). Try that if you haven't already.

When you reinstalled, did you use the default configuration for it?

If the DNS switch didn't work, visit [this site](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/) and then post anything red/orange which comes up.

Best of luck.

> [{quoted}](name=HORSE OF FORCE,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=AqEAms4d,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2015-01-27T07:23:46.457+0000)
>
> You aren't getting the same problem as many other Mac users are getting. Nevertheless, a solution they used was [temporarily switching over to Google's Public DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#mq3). Try that if you haven't already.
> 
> When you reinstalled, did you use the default configuration for it?
> 
> If the DNS switch didn't work, visit [this site](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/) and then post anything red/orange which comes up.
> 
> Best of luck.

Ah I see. 
Yes I am already using googles public DNS.
What do you mean by default configuration. 

I'll try it out. I' tested it, as shown below

Immediately remove that link. It contains personal information that can be used to track you.

But anyway, I still read it. There is either a problem with the way your DNS is configured or you just have really bad upload speeds. For now, I suggest switching back to your default DNS, unless if in doing that, RADS fails to launch.

By default configuration I mean to install it without changing any settings, like the installation path. Not too sure what entails it on Mac, though.

Ohh. I've tried changing back to default DNS. It worked once then it happened again. Not sure why. Maybe its my ISP. 

Yeah it's the default configuration. I've not changed anything.

>It worked once then it happened again.

So that means switching your DNS back fixed it?
Seems like it. But when I tried again it didnt work.
Have you tried flushing your DNS? Can you use a program like CCleaner to clean your registry?
I've tried that too. I think it's my isp because i was able to log in but then i got disconnected midgame. Thank you for all the help though :D. I'll fix this with my ISP.

Alright. That means I can't really be of much help now, but I would like to know if you fix this problem and what exactly your ISP did to fix it.

Knowledge is power!
Haha, yeah will let you know when I've got it fixed

Oki doki.

The main purpose of this message is to appear on your notifications. I know that it's solely the way I reply to people.
